channel.title: Reuters News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.

item.title: Iraqi military pushes deeper into Mosul's Old City
item.description: MOSUL, Iraq (Reuters) - Iraq's military pushed deeper into Mosul's Old City on Wednesday, taking two more districts from Islamic State and bringing it closer to total control of the city.

item.title: North Korea calls for execution of ex-South Korea leader over 'assassination' plot
item.description: SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korea said on Wednesday it has issued a standing order for the execution of former South Korean President Park Geun-hye and her spy chief for a plot to assassinate its leader, and it demanded that the South hand the pair over.

item.title: Venezuela hunts rogue helicopter attackers, Maduro foes smell rat
item.description: CARACAS (Reuters) - The Venezuelan government hunted on Wednesday for rogue policemen who attacked key installations by helicopter, but critics of President Nicolas Maduro suspected the raid may have been manipulated to justify repression.

item.title: U.S. says its warning appears to have averted Syrian chemical attack
item.description: BRUSSELS/ISTANBUL (Reuters) - U.S. Defence Secretary Jim Mattis said on Wednesday that the Syrian government of President Bashar al-Assad appeared so far to have heeded a warning this week from Washington not to carry out a chemical weapons attack.

item.title: New computer virus spreads from Ukraine to disrupt world business
item.description: FRANKFURT/MOSCOW/KIEV (Reuters) - A new cyber virus spread from Ukraine to wreak havoc around the globe on Wednesday, crippling thousands of computers, disrupting ports from Mumbai to Los Angeles and halting production at a chocolate factory in Australia.

item.title: Pro-Trump groups take no prisoners in rush to help an embattled president
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Flush with cash, political groups outside the White House are aggressively coming to President Donald Trump's aid as he battles low public approval numbers, questions about his election campaign's ties to Russia and a stalled legislative agenda.

item.title: More Venezuelan children dying from preventable diseases amid crisis
item.description: CARACAS/LA GUAJIRA, Venezuela (Reuters) - Twelve-year-old Samuel Becerra went to Venezuela's main paediatric hospital for routine dialysis in March.

item.title: U.N. rapporteur, media watchdog slam Qatar-based Al Jazeera closure demands
item.description: DUBAI (Reuters) - A United Nations expert and a media freedom watchdog on Wednesday criticised four Arab states for seeking to close Al Jazeera television in a rift with Qatar.

item.title: Protests held across India after attacks against Muslims
item.description: NEW DELHI/MUMBAI (Reuters) - Protests were held in cities across India on Wednesday against a wave of attacks on Muslims by mobs that accuse them of killing cows or eating beef.

item.title: Clergy at Catholic monastery in Vietnam say were assaulted over land dispute
item.description: HANOI (Reuters) - Catholic clergy in a monastery in Vietnam said they were beaten by people they believed were plain clothes police on Wednesday in an on-going land dispute.
